description: '''The Glove''' was a 1983 English musical collaboration and recording project by [[the Cure]]'s [[Robert Smith (musician)|Robert Smith]] and [[Siouxsie and the Banshees]]' [[Steven Severin]]. They released one studio album, ''[[Blue Sunshine (album)|Blue Sunshine]]'', in 1983 as part of Severin's solo deal with Polydor. The latter came up with the band name, the album title and the blue/yellow sleeve concept, as Smith had to leave the project before completion due to prior commitments with the Cure.
